DataElement.preferredName: Patient Experience Other Health Concerns Other Specify Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The free text field that describes another response when other is chosen from a list of values regarding the patients experience with other health concerns.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._The accumulation of knowledge or skill that results from direct participation in events or activities._Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned._Refers to a person's state of physical, mental and social well-being; usually it refers specifically to the state of being in good health, a state of complete physical, mental and social well-being, and does not consist only of the absence of disease or infirmity. In any organism health constitutes a form of homeostasis with inputs and outputs of energy and mass in approximate equilibrium allowing for growth and continued survival. In humans, a subjective feeling of well-being coming from somatic and cognitive perceptions is considered an essential component of health._A matter of interest or importance.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.:The state of the organism when it functions optimally without evidence of disease.:A matter of interest or importance.:The accumulation of knowledge or skill that results from direct participation in events or activities.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Refers to a person's state of physical, mental and social well-being; usually it refers specifically to the state of being in good health, a state of complete physical, mental and social well-being, and does not consist only of the absence of disease or infirmity. In any organism health constitutes a form of homeostasis with inputs and outputs of energy and mass in approximate equilibrium allowing for growth and continued survival. In humans, a subjective feeling of well-being coming from somatic and cognitive perceptions is considered an essential component of health.
A matter of interest or importance.
The accumulation of knowledge or skill that results from direct participation in events or activities.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The free text field that describes another response when other is chosen from a list of values.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Not otherwise specified.:Specify; be specific about something; define clearly.:Text; the words of something written.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.
Be specific about something; define clearly.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/22/17 tt transferred context, added registration status and CSI per Round 5 finalization task. Modified for The Cancer Genome Atlas (TCGA) by request of T. Lichtenberg (JP) 12/2010.
